channel.title: My First Ever HTML Homepage - For My Friend
channel.description:
First ever I created using dreamweaver. CC please. This page isn't for me though.[br][size=1]Posted at: May 14, 2006, 05:19:00 am[/size][hr]I couldn't seem to put it as any other than a .txt file because of the restrictions on what I can/can't post.
[hr]I couldn't edit it that much because there was restrictions on the template. I couldn't see what colors I should change. I think they go together wuite well, but that's just me :) [/hr]

item.title: My First Ever HTML Homepage - For My Friend
item.dc:creator: @Duncan Duncan
item.description:
@Duncan wrote:

The keys to a nice looking website are:
- Red
- Blue
- Simple

The reasoning:

Red: The only two colors a baby can see when its born are red and black. As a resault, it is pleasing to the eye thoughout our lives. Put MAIN content in red
Blue: Blue is another very pleasing color. Put your not so important content in blue. Such as the not main part of a logo
Simple: If too much is going on, your eye will jump across the screen looking at the main colors. This will cause you to miss possibly important content.

Read full topic
item.source: My First Ever HTML Homepage - For My Friend

item.title: My First Ever HTML Homepage - For My Friend
item.dc:creator: @itendsnow itendsnow
item.description:
@itendsnow wrote:

Looks like you downloaded this from dreamwaver-templates.org Judging by the page title…but seems to be ok, need to keep to one set of colours I can see roughly 10 different colours and they don’t really compliment each other. The layour seems solid however you may want to make the navigation on the left a bit smaller as it takes up quite alot of space and pushes the left navigation past the edge of the header.

-ryan

Read full topic
